abstract: Iran's judiciary sentences two people to 10 years in prison who were convicted of spying for United States and Israel, but does not release names; remains unknown whether Washington Post reporter Jason Rezaian, who faces similar espionage charges, was one of them.
lead_paragraph: The judiciary did not release the names of the two people convicted of spying for the United States and Israel.

headline.main: Jason Rezaian’s Status Unclear After Iran Sentences 2
headline.print_headline: Reporter’s Status Unclear After Iran Sentences 2

snippet: The judiciary did not release the names of the two people convicted of spying for the United States and Israel.
